title: To all those butthurt Katarina mains...
body:
We don't care. Yes, it may have been fun to ward hop, but it was broken. Yes, it may have been fun to smash your face on the keyboard and get a pentakill, but it was broken. 

The new katarina actually allows for her opponents to react instead of getting instakilled with no possible hope of reacting. And she takes skill now. If anything, she's probably stronger than she was before the rework, its just now you actually have to learn how to play her well.

So please, shhh. No matter what you say Riot is not going to revert her back to her pre-rework. And for a good reason too, because this rework is fair for **everybody**. Marksmen, squishies, immobile champs and even katarina.

replies.body: Wait? Kat taking skill!!??? ABOUT BLOODY TIME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Sick of getting 1v5'd by a Katarina which many kat mains says she was "Balanced" "BALANCED"
Old Kat took a surprising amount of skill, but not enough to make her hard to play.

she took knowledge of how to snowball hard, since if she was behind she was pretty much screwed unless the team had largescale cc for her ult. She was easy when snowballing and hard to play when behind or losing lane.

I'm making a vid about her now.

Somethings I discovered. 
You cant shunpo to wards (Probably a good thing)
BUT you can shunpo to plants (Even tho they are meh)

But you can still use plants as an escape tool now.

Oohs that's actually pretty cool
The new Kat requires a lot of skill... but she's at least 3 times more OP than the old Kat...

Knives are better than wards anyways, many times more reliable. 

Who honestly thinks ward hopping was a good intuitive mechanic? All it does is encourage sacrificing potential vision for a dash which isn't exactly what you want to do all the time.

To be honest, I really like the changes they made. I may have only played one game with her (and against another Kat in-lane, mind you) but it just seems a great improvement. She really seems a lot more intuitive and flowing now. Before the change I had quite a bit of difficulty managing to use her even decently, but now I can just jump in and be able to pull off amazing plays (well, amazing for a Silver who should probably be Bronze) without having to spend 50+ games practising. Then, at the same time, I know I'm just not using her to her full potential. If I *did* put the time in to practice, I'm confident I could do it. This just feels like how champions like Kat *should* work, and Riot have pulled it off quite well in my opinion.
Actually i like her more now o.O am i the only one?

I agree to be honest.

First few games with new katarina went like shit but after i started to get the hang of her i realised there is so much more damage potential there.

Infact only issue i actually have with new kat is the playstyle seems kind of self contradictory, she still needs to wait till the perfect scenario to be able to engage but she now also has a slight bit of setup required with dagger placement.

Works fine in teamfights, infact works better than ever in teamfights, just makes her early game trades a little worse (or harder i guess is the better word)
